requirement.userstory: hgfhfghg
hbdfgdfgfdg
As a Project Creator, I want to add a new project with a name, id, deadline, starting date and methodology, so that work on that project can start.

As a Product Owner, I want to add a new requirement with id, a user story, an estimated time, a deadline, a priority and the type of requirement (functional, non-functional or project related requirement), so that the project development can begin.
As a Scrum Master, I want to add a new task with an id, title, an estimated time and a deadline, so that the team members can start working.
As a Project Creator, I want to edit a project’s details, so that I get a better overview of which projects are finished and which are not.
As a Product Owner, I want to edit a requirement’s details including its status, so that the progress of the requirement is up to date.
As a Scrum Master, I want to edit a task’s details including status, total hours worked on the task and which team members worked on the task, so that I keep the task updated.
As a Project Creator, I want to assign and unassign team members with or without a special role from a project, so that the team members know which project they are currently working on.

As a Project Creator, I want to assign team members with a certain role and edit their roles: the Scrum Master, the Product Owner and the responsible team members for requirements/tasks, so that there is good coordination and cooperation within the project.
As a responsible team member for a specific task, I want to report when the task has ended, so that the Scrum Master is up to date with the implementation process.

As a Customer, I want to view the details of the company, the project team, the status of my own project, a table displaying all the requirements for the project including the type, the deadline and the status of the specific requirement so that I can see the progress of a project and get a better overview of the company.
The GUI is implemented in JavaFX.
The website should work on the most common web browsers - Internet Explorer (v11), Microsoft Edge (v84), Mozilla Firefox (v81), Google Chrome (v86).
Available on Windows 10.
As a Developer, I want to view the projects sorted by methodology or status, so that I have a better view of the projects.
As a Developer, I want to view the requirements sorted by status and priority, so that I have a better view of the requirements.
As a Developer, I want to view the tasks sorted by status, so that I have a better view of the tasks.
As a Developer, I want a project’s status to automatically be marked as “Ended” when all its requirements have been completed and approved, so that the list of projects is much more organised.
As a Developer, I want a requirement’s status to automatically turn to the ‘Ended’ state when all its tasks have been completed, so that the list of requirements can be prioritised.
As a Developer, I want to search for a particular project, so that I can easily find and view that specific project’s details.

As a Developer, I want to view the team members working on a project, sorted by name, productivity or how many tasks they are working on, so that I can see which team members are working on that specific project/requirement/task.
As a Developer, I want to report the amount of hours worked on a specific task, so that the total daily hours spent on each task can be easily calculated.
As a Product Owner, I want to prioritize a requirement, so that the Scrum Master is aware of the importance of the requirement.
As a Developer, I want the amount of hours worked to update automatically to the total hours worked, so that I know how much time was spent on each requirement/task.
As a Developer, I want the display of my productivity to update automatically in the team members’ profile, so that I don’t have to spend time updating it manually.
As a Customer, I want to search for a particular project, so that I can easily find a project and view all available details within that specific project.
As a Developer, I want to search for a particular requirement, so that I can easily find and view that specific requirement’s details.
As a Developer, I want to search for a particular task, so that I can easily find and view that specific task’s details.
As a Developer, I want to search for a particular team member by name or Id, so that I can view their related projects, see productivity, and with whom they worked the most.
As a Project Creator, I want to sort all team members by activity, so that I know which team members have the biggest productivity.
As a Project Creator, I want to delete a project, so that the list of projects will be updated.
As a Product Owner, I want to delete a requirement, so that the requirements of the project are up to date with what I want.
As a Scrum Master, I want to delete a task, so that the list of tasks is up to date.
As a Developer, I want the entire information of a single project to be stored in a single file, so that it can be accessed when searching for historical data.
As a Product Owner, I want to edit the project’s randomly generated ID, so that I can change it into something I can more easily remember.

As a Project Creator, I want a project to be assigned with a randomly generated ID (that functions as a password), so that users on the website need to enter the specific ID in order to view a project.
